result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Marion Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 9/1/2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

records.addlTxt: Per Request and Order to Correct submitted to Court on 12/7/2015; signed on 12/11/2015.
15A 044126/reapplied
Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.

JOC shows defendant was sentenced on count one.  Dispo on count two entered as dismissed and read in, in CCAP.
TO CORRECT to show defendant was found guilty and sentenced as to COUNT TWO.  And COUNT ONE was dismissed and read in.
records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt: 15A 042905/reversed to correct

Defendant Melvin Marion Collins in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Melvin Marion Collins in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
Ast to Count 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with credit of 41 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for school.  

Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 9-01-2016.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
